title: Rehoboth (Bible)
text:
Rehoboth (, "Reḥovot"; lit. "broad places") is the name of three <a href="Bible">biblical</a> places:
Nabatean and Byzantine town in the Negev.
The town's ruins, called in Arabic "Khirbet Ruheibeh", are located in the Wadi er-Ruheibeh area, where Isaac's well was (). This was a thriving city in Byzantine times. In Israel today it is called "Rehovot ba-Negev" (Rehovot-in-the-<a href="Negev">Negev</a>). It was apparently founded in the first century AD by the <a href="Nabateans">Nabateans</a>. It grew to more than 10,000 people by the fifth century, thanks to its being on the <a href="Incense%20Route">Incense Route</a>.
